SENT.plain: BACKGROUND: Nonlethal missile injuries to the dural venous sinus system are rare
To date successful repair of isolated penetrating injury to the torcular herophili has not been reported without significant associated morbidity
We report the case of a gunshot wound injury to the occipital region with retained bullet fragment in the confluence of the sinuses causing traumatic sinus venous thrombosis
METHODS: Occipital and suboccipital craniotomy for removal of bullet in the torcula, repair of sinus defect, and repair of depressed skull bone fragments was performed
RESULTS: The procedure resulted in restoration of proximal and distal flow across the dural sinus system and preservation of torcular sinus patency with excellent neurological outcome
Technical considerations in the repair of penetrating torcular injuries are discussed

CONCLUSIONS: Gunshot wounds with retained bullet fragments in the torcula can be successfully repaired with preservation of neurological function after retrieval of metallic foreign body and restoration of venous sinus patency
